register.description:
Vector Configuration 0
AUX_SCE wakeup vector 0 and 1 configuration

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Vector 1 trigger event polarity.
To manually trigger vector 1 execution: - AUX_SCE must sleep. - Set VEC1_EV to a known static value. - Toggle VEC1_POL twice.

Vector 1 trigger enable.
When enabled, VEC1_EV event with VEC1_POL polarity triggers a jump to vector # 1 when AUX_SCE sleeps.
Lower vectors (0) have priority.
Select vector 1 trigger source event.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Vector 0 trigger event polarity.
To manually trigger vector 0 execution: - AUX_SCE must sleep. - Set VEC0_EV to a known static value. - Toggle VEC0_POL twice.

Vector 0 trigger enable.
When enabled, VEC0_EV event with VEC0_POL polarity triggers a jump to vector # 0 when AUX_SCE sleeps.
Select vector 0 trigger source event.

register.description:
Vector Configuration 1
AUX_SCE event vectors 2 and 3 configuration

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Vector 3 trigger event polarity.
To manually trigger vector 3 execution: - AUX_SCE must sleep. - Set VEC3_EV to a known static value. - Toggle VEC3_POL twice.

Vector 3 trigger enable.
When enabled, VEC3_EV event with VEC3_POL polarity triggers a jump to vector # 3 when AUX_SCE sleeps.
Lower vectors (0, 1, and 2) have priority.
Select vector 3 trigger source event.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Vector 2 trigger event polarity.
To manually trigger vector 2 execution: - AUX_SCE must sleep. - Set VEC2_EV to a known static value. - Toggle VEC2_POL twice.

Vector 2 trigger enable.
When enabled, VEC2_EV event with VEC2_POL polarity triggers a jump to vector # 2 when AUX_SCE sleeps.
Lower vectors (0 and 1) have priority.
Select vector 2 trigger source event.

register.description:
Sensor Controller Engine Wait Event Selection
Configuration of this register controls bit index 7 in AUX_SCE:WUSTAT.EV_SIGNALS. This bit can be used by AUX_SCE WEV0, WEV1, BEV0 and BEV1 instructions

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Select event source to connect to AUX_SCE:WUSTAT.EV_SIGNALS bit 7.

register.description:
Events To AON Flags
This register contains a collection of event flags routed to AON_EVENT.
To clear an event flag, write to EVTOAONFLAGSCLR or write 0 to event flag in this register.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOAONPOL.TIMER1_EV occurs on EVSTAT0.TIMER1_EV.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOAONPOL.TIMER0_EV occurs on EVSTAT0.TIMER0_EV.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOAONPOL.TDC_DONE occurs on EVSTAT0.TDC_DONE.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOAONPOL.ADC_DONE occurs on EVSTAT0.ADC_DONE.
This event flag is set when edge selected by EVTOAONPOL.AUX_COMPB occurs on EVSTAT0.AUX_COMPB.
This event flag is set when edge selected by EVTOAONPOL.AUX_COMPA occurs on EVSTAT0.AUX_COMPA.
This event flag is set when software writes a 1 to SWEVSET.SWEV2.
This event flag is set when software writes a 1 to SWEVSET.SWEV1.
This event flag is set when software writes a 1 to SWEVSET.SWEV0.

register.description:
Events To AON Polarity
Event source polarity configuration for EVTOAONFLAGS.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Select the level of EVSTAT0.TIMER1_EV that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.TIMER1_EV.
Select the level of EVSTAT0.TIMER0_EV that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.TIMER0_EV.
Select level of EVSTAT0.TDC_DONE that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.TDC_DONE.
Select the level of EVSTAT0.ADC_DONE that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.ADC_DONE.
Select the edge of EVSTAT0.AUX_COMPB that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_COMPB.
Select the edge of EVSTAT0.AUX_COMPA that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_COMPA.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
UDMA0 Request mode

bitenum.token: Single requests are generated on UDMA0 channel 7 when the condition configured in SEL is met.
bitenum.description: Single requests are generated on UDMA0 channel 7 when the condition configured in SEL is met.

bitenum.token: Burst requests are generated on UDMA0 channel 7 when the condition configured in SEL is met.
bitenum.description: Burst requests are generated on UDMA0 channel 7 when the condition configured in SEL is met.

bitfield.description:
uDMA ADC interface enable.
0: Disable UDMA0 interface to ADC. 1: Enable UDMA0 interface to ADC.
Select FIFO watermark level required to trigger a UDMA0 transfer of ADC FIFO data.

bitenum.token: UDMA0 trigger event will be generated when the ADC FIFO is almost full (3/4 full).
bitenum.description: UDMA0 trigger event will be generated when the ADC FIFO is almost full (3/4 full).

bitenum.token: UDMA0 trigger event will be generated when there are samples in the ADC FIFO.
bitenum.description: UDMA0 trigger event will be generated when there are samples in the ADC FIFO.

register.description:
Software Event Set
Set software event flags from AUX domain to AON and MCU domains. CPUs in MCU domain can read the event flags from EVTOAONFLAGS and clear them in EVTOAONFLAGSCLR.
Use of these event flags is software-defined.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Software event flag 2.
0: No effect. 1: Set software event flag 2.

Software event flag 1.
0: No effect. 1: Set software event flag 1.

Software event flag 0.
0: No effect. 1: Set software event flag 0.

register.description:
Event Status 0
Register holds events 0 thru 15 of the 32-bit event bus that is synchronous to AUX clock. The following subscribers use the asynchronous version of events in this register. - AUX_ANAIF. - AUX_TDC.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
AUXIO2 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 2.
AUXIO1 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 1.
AUXIO0 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 0.
AON_EVENT:AUXWUSEL.WU2_EV OR AON_EVENT:AUXWUSEL.WU1_EV OR AON_EVENT:AUXWUSEL.WU0_EV
Observation input 1 from IOC. This event is configured by IOC:OBSAUXOUTPUT.SEL1.
Observation input 0 from IOC. This event is configured by IOC:OBSAUXOUTPUT.SEL0 and can be overridden by IOC:OBSAUXOUTPUT.SEL_MISC.
AUX_ANAIF ADC conversion done event.
See AUX_SMPH:AUTOTAKE.SMPH_ID for description.
AUX_TIMER1_EV event, see AUX_TIMER:T1TARGET for description.
AUX_TIMER0_EV event, see AUX_TIMER:T0TARGET for description.
AUX_TDC:STAT.DONE
Comparator B output
Comparator A output

register.description:
Event Status 1
Current event source levels, 31:16

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

The logical function for this event is configurable.
When DMACTL.EN = 1 : Event = UDMA0 Channel 7 done event OR AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.OVERFLOW OR AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.UNDERFLOW
When DMACTL.EN = 0 : Event = (NOT AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.EMPTY) OR AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.OVERFLOW OR AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.UNDERFLOW
Bit 7 in UDMA0:DONEMASK must be 0.
Event from EVENT configured by EVENT:AUXSEL0.
TDC reference clock. It is configured by DDI_0_OSC:CTL0.ACLK_REF_SRC_SEL and enabled by AUX_WUC:REFCLKCTL.REQ.
AUXIO15 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 7.
AUXIO14 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 6.
AUXIO13 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 5.
AUXIO12 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 4.
AUXIO11 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 3.
AUXIO10 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 2.
AUXIO9 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 1.
AUXIO8 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 0.
AUXIO7 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 7.
AUXIO6 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 6.
AUXIO5 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 5.
AUXIO4 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 4.
AUXIO3 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 3.

register.description:
Event To MCU Polarity
Event source polarity configuration for EVTOMCUFLAGS.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_IRQ.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.OBSMUX0.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_DONE.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.TIMER1_EV.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.TIMER0_EV.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.TDC_DONE.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_COMPB.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_COMPA.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AON_WU_EV.

register.description:
Events to MCU Flags
This register contains a collection of event flags routed to MCU domain.
To clear an event flag, write to EVTOMCUFLAGSCLR or write 0 to event flag in this register. Follow procedure described in AUX_SYSIF:WUCLR to clear AUX_WU_EV event flag.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.ADC_IRQ occurs on EVSTAT0.ADC_IRQ.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.MCU_OBSMUX0 occurs on EVSTAT0.MCU_OBSMUX0.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL occurs on EVSTAT0.ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.ADC_DONE occurs on EVSTAT0.ADC_DONE.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE occurs on EVSTAT0.SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.TIMER1_EV occurs on EVSTAT0.TIMER1_EV.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.TIMER0_EV occurs on EVSTAT0.TIMER0_EV.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.TDC_DONE occurs on EVSTAT0.TDC_DONE.
This event flag is set when edge selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_COMPB occurs on EVSTAT0.AUX_COMPB.
This event flag is set when edge selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_COMPA occurs on EVSTAT0.AUX_COMPA.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AON_WU_EV occurs on the reduction-OR of the AUX_EVCTL:EVSTAT0.RTC_CH2_EV, AUX_EVCTL:EVSTAT0.AON_SW, and AUX_EVCTL:EVSTAT0.AON_PROG_WU events.

register.description:
Combined Event To MCU Mask
Select event flags in EVTOMCUFLAGS that contribute to the AUX_COMB event to EVENT and system CPU.
The AUX_COMB event is high as long as one or more of the included event flags are set.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_IRQ contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.MCU_OBSMUX0 contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_DONE contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.TIMER1_EV contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.TIMER0_EV contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.TDC_DONE contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_COMPB contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_COMPA contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.AON_WU_EV contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

register.description:
Vector Flags
If a vector flag becomes 1 and AUX_SCE sleeps, AUX_SCE will wake up and execute the corresponding vector. The vector with the lowest index will execute first if multiple vectors flags are set. AUX_SCE must return to sleep to execute the next vector.
During execution of a vector, AUX_SCE must clear the vector flag that triggered execution. Write 1 to bit index n in VECFLAGSCLR to clear vector flag n.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Vector flag 3.
The vector flag is set if the edge selected VECCFG1.VEC3_POL occurs on the event selected in VECCFG1.VEC3_EV.
The flag is cleared by writing a 0 to this bit, or (preferably) a 1 to VECFLAGSCLR.VEC3.

Vector flag 2.
The vector flag is set if the edge selected VECCFG1.VEC2_POL occurs on the event selected in VECCFG1.VEC2_EV.
The flag is cleared by writing a 0 to this bit, or (preferably) a 1 to VECFLAGSCLR.VEC2.

Vector flag 1.
The vector flag is set if the edge selected VECCFG0.VEC1_POL occurs on the event selected in VECCFG0.VEC1_EV.
The flag is cleared by writing a 0 to this bit, or (preferably) a 1 to VECFLAGSCLR.VEC1.

Vector flag 0.
The vector flag is set if the edge selected VECCFG0.VEC0_POL occurs on the event selected in VECCFG0.VEC0_EV.
The flag is cleared by writing a 0 to this bit, or (preferably) a 1 to VECFLAGSCLR.VEC0.

register.description:
Events To MCU Flags Clear
Clear event flags in EVTOMCUFLAGS.
In order to clear a level sensitive event flag, the event must be deasserted.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_IRQ.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.MCU_OBSMUX0.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_DONE.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.TIMER1_EV.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.TIMER0_EV.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.TDC_DONE.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_COMPB.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_COMPA.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AON_WU_EV.
Read value is 0.

register.description:
Events To AON Clear
Clear event flags in EVTOAONFLAGS.
In order to clear a level sensitive event flag, the event must be deasserted.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.TIMER1_EV.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.TIMER0_EV.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.TDC_DONE.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.ADC_DONE.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_COMPB.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_COMPA.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.SWEV2.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.SWEV1.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.SWEV0.
Read value is 0.

register.description:
Vector Flags Clear
Strobes for clearing flags in VECFLAGS.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Clear vector flag 3.
0: No effect. 1: Clear VECFLAGS.VEC3.
Read value is 0.

Clear vector flag 2.
0: No effect. 1: Clear VECFLAGS.VEC2.
Read value is 0.

Clear vector flag 1.
0: No effect. 1: Clear VECFLAGS.VEC1.
Read value is 0.

Clear vector flag 0.
0: No effect. 1: Clear VECFLAGS.VEC0.
Read value is 0.
